meanings.definition: The quality or state of being plastic.
meanings.sent1: The plasticities of the clay allowed the artist to create various shapes.
meanings.sent2: The plasticities of the material made it easy to mold into different forms.
meanings.sent3: The plasticities of the dough made it fun for the kids to shape into animals.
meanings.sent4: Her mind had the plasticities of a sculptor, shaping thoughts into beautiful ideas.
meanings.sent5: The plasticities of the fabric made it perfect for designing flexible clothing.

meanings.definition: The capability of being molded or shaped.

meanings.sent2: The plasticities of the metal made it ideal for crafting intricate designs.
meanings.sent3: The plasticities of the clay made it easy for the potter to shape a vase.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination had the plasticities of clay, easily molded into creative stories.

meanings.definition: The ability to be easily influenced or changed.

meanings.sent3: The plasticities of the weather made it unpredictable for planning outdoor events.

meanings.sent5: The plasticities of technology constantly shape our daily routines.
